channel.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
channel.description:
[url]https://www.vg247.com/2012/04/07/dark-souls-pc-confirmed-in-german-magazine/[/url]
Pretty much every rumor lately was leading up to this.
I already have the game for the PS3 but I'm glad they're bringing this for PC finally.
Just hope the port is decent and the franchise gets PC versions from now own.

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
Screenshots look at high res. I picked this up last night, so hopefully I’ll be able to dick around and get the mod working tonight.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Kairouseki:

https://www.neogaf.com/forum/showthread.php?p=41336203

Some guy modded the game to run natively at 1080p+ within the first hour of the release (23 minutes is the official time apparently) without access to the source code, only messing around with DX9. I think this is really funny and kind of sad at the same time.

SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I get the feeling we’ll probably be able to muck around in some text files for extra stuff (just due to the nature of most games) or at least some mods will come out to fix it. GFWL part is shit though, and not being experienced making PC ports is no excuse for that.

I was right haha, although I didn’t expect it to be that fast damn.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: King_Kaddo
item.description:
Lol fixed resolution and fps. What is this, 1980?

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I don’t think the resolution is going to be changeable even in the files. In the article it says that the internal framebuffer is locked at that resolution. I don’t think doing anything in the files will be able to raise that, it seems like some hardlocked shit. It’d be nice if someone figured out how to after release though, I’m sure there’s going to be a lot of people looking for ways in any case.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Even if we can change the res through text files…are you fucking kidding me? The last game I played that I had no way to change the resolution in game or at least through a launcher was GL Quake - which came out in 1997.

Read full topic

item.description:
I get the feeling we’ll probably be able to muck around in some text files for extra stuff (just due to the nature of most games) or at least some mods will come out to fix it. GFWL part is shit though, and not being experienced making PC ports is no excuse for that.

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-08-09-dark-souls-pc-preview-the-devils-bargain

Game will be locked at 1024x720, the resolution setting only upscaling it it seems. It’s also locked at 30 fps. GFWL as well. This is shaping up to be the worst PC port ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Bloodshot:

Even so that doesn’t really matter, because if they are bad to the point it’s noticeable on a PC, if you go up to them at that resolution on a console they’d still look pretty bad.

Exactly. Besides, the lower texture detail on console games is more because of limited RAM than rendering resolution.

They need to pack a huge amount of stuff into just little less than 512 MB of RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Even so that doesn’t really matter, because if they are bad to the point it’s noticeable on a PC, if you go up to them at that resolution on a console they’d still look pretty bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Maxey:

You’re over-complicating that shit in your head. Texture resolution in games has nothing to do with screen resolution.

If that were true we would be forced to play HL1 at like 128x128.

That’s not really what I meant. I was thinking that if the textures were made for a game that was going to be played at 720p then if you were to play with the same textures at 1080p then they wouldn’t look very good.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Kairouseki:

What I meant is that there are two options for what they said:

  1. The resolution would be locked to 720p
  2. The resolutions of the textures would not be increased in the PC version, meaning we would be playing at 1080p with the same textures that the console version was using at 720p

I originally thought using the same textures in a higher resolution would make the game look very bad but apparently that isn’t the case.

There will still be advantages to playing in higher resolutions. Such as smoother edges.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed

item.description:
You’re over-complicating that shit in your head. Texture resolution in games has nothing to do with screen resolution.

If that were true we would be forced to play HL1 at like 128x128.

What I meant is that there are two options for what they said:

  1. The resolution would be locked to 720p
  2. The resolutions of the textures would not be increased in the PC version, meaning we would be playing at 1080p with the same textures that the console version was using at 720p

I originally thought using the same textures in a higher resolution would make the game look very bad but apparently that isn’t the case.

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Kairouseki:

or the textures will be the same as the console versions, meaning 720p.

I don’t think I’ve ever heard of a game locking the resolution because of texture quality.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Apparently the textures being the same resolution as on the consoles is pretty common and typically doesn’t cause a lot of problems. Did not know that.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Yeah, even the shittiest of ports have resolution options.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
GFWL has not been confirmed by the developers yet, so there’s a chance it might not use it. As for the resolution, it will have to have a choice of different resolutions since not all brands of monitors are compatible with 16:9 aspect ratio.

Besides, you’d have to be doing a bad port on purpose to not include resolution options.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Anybody still following this? There are so many problems that are cropping up. GFWL is one, which people are trying to get removed. Just recently it’s been revealed that it will most likely be locked at 30 fps because of how the game was made, and that either the resolution will be locked at 720p or the textures will be the same as the console versions, meaning 720p.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
TheKeeper:

Yea so that a much to large majority of “fans” can pirate it and play it for free, right?

Even with piracy they’ll probably make money on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
Agreed. The way the controls are now on the PS3, a direct port would never work. I hope they take the time to build an interface that works well with M/KB and don’t just say expect PC gamers to use a gamepad.

Otherwise, I just want to see framerate issues fixed from the PS3 version and I’ll be happy.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls for PC confirmed
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
I hope they get the PC controlling right. I know that the game is fucking hard and bad controlling would be very frustrating.

Read full topic
